content: More like this please!

I can not stress this enough, this game is worth every penny. This story has beautiful and loveable characters, going through one of the most tragic and harsh war within the past 100 years. There are three main characters you shadow and control. Each having there own Unique and Absolutely beautiful story. There are a few glitches though, as if you leave the app during a page where you choose a action. The action is chosen randomly. I've felt so many emotions playing this game, congrats devs!!
This was an incredible journey. High quality, really fleshed out story.
Excellent writing, the fate of all the main characters depends exclusively on the player. Great story that nicely describes war. Overall, a good novel. Would recommend

This book is actually written incredibly well. You can make choices that get your character killed, make your character an outright killer or even get them pregnant. So many different possible variations of this story is where this book really shines. This book is perfect for a history afficionado. Historically accurate. The material is a bit dry the first few pages and the narrative can be confusing. Switching points of view can make you unsure what side your fighting for. Still a good read.

A good book but I would have loved if it was an rpg type of book that you 
can choose your character and choose what group and factions you want to be 
in but it's good
it was good
I'd read Homage to Catalonia so had some idea of the history but this was awesome- really immersive!
I love seeing the comments of "Ewww violence" what did you expect in a war book? Sure they are pictures and I am confused why they were included but all of that did happen..

Amazing! Historically very accurate, I would say not just about the course of the events but also the social mindset. The action is vibrant, and the choices keep you in tension and involved. Just one thing that buggers me, Gabrielle does not soud to me as a spanish name. Is it meant to be french?
This is some brutal history with actual photos (including people holding human heads).  I just couldn't get into it personally.
It's one of the best written Choose Your Own Adventure Games I ever play! With actually meaningful choices!!!!
Best choice game I've played so far. Not too long, not too short. Very educative as well. Your decisions don't influence the game THAT much but nevertheless worth the price without a doubt.
We need more of this kind of game. I love the setting of the story, which is a departure from the usual fantasy or distance future
Great time waster and you learn history while your at it

People usually make games of choice in different settings, usually fantasy. This was a nice turn from that. Although the choices are fairly unimportant in themselves, its still a great and educational read. I have always had an interest in the SCW, and the time period, and this was a fun way to explore it. Btw, dont listen to the guy who posted that you need to remove the images. That dude apparently though he was downloading a different game (its about a very tragic civil war in spanish history bro).
U must remove the horrible photos of ppl holding heads etc. Until u do that I won't rate this. Also needs a warning for ptsd. Sufferers.

Relatively short and less choices. But that doesn't hurt the narrative, it helps it. When a choice does come along, it has heavy weight where your character can die and the story continues. You grow to like these characters even if you don't agree with them. First COG that makes me regret some choices.

I knew nothing about Spanish Civil War. This story immersed me in it and gave me 4 different angles from which to do it. So engaging. So awesome. But there were a few typos here and there, my only criticism.
Doesn't keep my attention for more than 10 minutes. Not as fun as some of the other titles from Hosted and CoG.

While the author definitely needs to proofread his/her text, the story was well-interwoven with a lot of research obviously done to ensure accuracy. It focuses on a major modern civil war that is often overlooked and overshadowed by the World Wars of the same period. Great read (if you don't mind tpyos.)

Amazing, worth the money 100%. I always read the reviews pre-purchase to choice games, and this one stuck out. Immediately I wasted a good hour and a half simply absorbing all the information in each choice and result. You'll find yourself hating the view of some characters, but trying as hard as you can to keep them alive. Seriously just a wonderful story with a nice set of choices.

Writing is good.  Just not what I look for in a Choice game. I want immersion.  I just couldn't get into it. I like to create a persona, mold it into something. It makes me care about the main character(s).  In this, I just didn't care.  This would have been better as a short story without the choices. Just my opinion.
The words were perfect and the story was amazing.
Pretty clear the author's put effort into researching and describing details, but the writing feels a little heavy-handed and the glitches of tense and punctuation are distracting.
